0.text:
Hello everybody, Claudia Boleyn here and this
is my weekly vlog. I don't actually know what

4.text:
to talk about because I'm not used to doing
vlogs really, I'm used to talking about a

7.text:
topic, so I guess I can tell you about what
happened this week. I suppose that's the idea

14.text:
of a vlog. Well, I had a really bad Sunday
basically. As you might know if you follow

19.text:
me on tumblr, oh my god I had such a bad day.
I had this argument with members of my family

26.text:
at the table on Sunday, and like partly it
was my fault because I get really really emotional

33.text:
about stuff like I have a really bad problem
with controlling my emotions when it gets

38.text:
to a certain point and I just get really upset,
so basically we're having this debate, this

44.text:
perfectly ordinary debate in which I, I mean
I do think that the point of view they're

48.text:
putting across is really bad like really horrible
but anyway, so we were in this massive debate

52.text:
and I just start crying which is the most
embarrassing thing because the worst thing

57.text:
you want to do when you're in the middle of
an argument and you're trying to be all righteous

60.text:
and put across your point of view in a mature
manner is to just burst out crying. But sometimes

66.text:
I can't help it, I mean it's why I wouldn't
make a politician because I just cry during

71.text:
confrontation sometimes. And it's really weird
when it happens. I mean sometimes I'm really

77.text:
cool and collected and I can just be like
an ice queen and just argue my point but sometimes

81.text:
for reasons unknown to me I just start shaking
and crying and it gets really upsetting and

86.text:
personal. I guess the topic we were talking
about was kind of personal to me and to be

91.text:
fair on my family they didn't necessarily
know it was really personal to me but anyway,

95.text:
I'm not going to talk about the actual argument
because I mean, I think my reaction was, you

100.text:
know, it wasn't the right sort of reaction
to have but then I am mentally ill and I find

103.text:
that very difficult. But I think it's difficult
sometimes when you love members of your family

109.text:
and you respect them and you just adore them
but then they come out with an opinion which

113.text:
you think is just scarily gross, and that's
really difficult I find because especially

119.text:
being into like social justice and that kind
of thing, it's like, where do you hit that

124.text:
balance? Can you separate the person from
their opinion? And I just find that really

130.text:
really tough to kind of think about people
who I really love and respect thinking stuff

135.text:
which I think is kind of wrong, but then I
am tolerant of other opinions, I mean I'm

139.text:
never gonna tell someone you shouldn't have
an opinion or you shouldn't express it. Even

144.text:
if you're like an anti-feminist, racist, horrible
homophobe, you know, you should still have

148.text:
the right to speak your opinion. People can
call bullshit, of course, when you talk. But

153.text:
you still have the right to your opinion.
But anyway, that's something that I struggle

156.text:
with constantly. I guess it's just aligning
people with their opinions and seeing them

164.text:
as whole people and, I don't know, I just
find that so difficult.

172.text:
I think with me, I like to think of myself
as a forgiving person but to a point. I'm

177.text:
on a different subject now, but it's kind
of related. It's like I can forgive a person

181.text:
for pretty much anything if they've wronged
me if they give me a sincere apology and I

187.text:
see that they're going to change and I see
that they know what they've done, so I suppose

192.text:
I am actually quite a forgiving person, but
I'm not a forgiving person if I don't think

197.text:
somebody means an apology. So that's another
issue I have. Yeah, I find that very difficult

205.text:
and it's difficult to come to terms with certain
things in my life because I think society

211.text:
wants you to love and forgive certain people
for certain things that they do, but when

215.text:
you know that that person isn't apologetic
and doesn't even see the problem it's difficult

220.text:
to forgive that person. Anyway, I've gone
off completely on a tangent. I think if you're

225.text:
into social justice and you're an activist,
that kind of thing then you'll probably get

228.text:
what I'm getting at here. Cause I think this
is stuff that a lot of us struggle with cause

232.text:
I think a lot of us used to be pretty shitty
people and we probably still are. I mean,

236.text:
I used to believe a load of shitty things.
You absorb stuff from the society around you

241.text:
and you absorb stuff from your family and
you just, you only see a certain world view,

246.text:
so if the media's pushing something at you
and the rest of society's like, yeah, that's

249.text:
the way to think, then you tend to go that
way. I feel like I've changed a lot over the

255.text:
past year or so and my opinions have got better
and more tolerant and i'm aware of more different

260.text:
groups of people and their struggles and I'm
still working on that. So I try not to be

265.text:
too harsh and unforgiving on people who I
think are ignorant about issues because like

269.text:
a year or two ago that was me and I was a
horrible person and I probably wouldn't have

273.text:
liked me from a couple of years ago now. So
that's why I try and be really forgiving and

277.text:
stuff about certain opinions. But some, some
opinions and some things, they just set me

283.text:
off, basically.
This video's been so incredibly vague and

287.text:
you haven't really got anything from it, I've
been vague about everything, I haven't mentioned

290.text:
any names or any topics or anything. But I
can't because I think when it's about your

294.text:
family, I mean some things are really personal
and I don't want you to think badly of my

298.text:
family and, you know, I love my family and
I do respect them even if I think some of

304.text:
the opinions that come out of their mouths
can be pretty appalling.

307.text:
Also that's another thing. I don't think opinions
are sacred. I think a lot of people are, they

313.text:
feel like if you attack someone's opinion
then you're attacking them. But I don't think

317.text:
that's true, I think that holding opinions
as sacred is kind of dangerous. Like on Sunday

322.text:
I attacked someone's opinion quite ruthlessly,
I really went in for this opinion. But I didn't

327.text:
go in for the person, and I think a lot of
people can't see the difference in that. So

332.text:
it might look to, it looked to some members
of my family like, oh my god you're being

336.text:
so mean to this member of your family, but
it wasn't against that person because I love

342.text:
that person so much. It was against the opinion.
So basically I don't think that opinions are

347.text:
sacred. For example if you think my opinions
are bullshit then I am 100% fine with you

352.text:
being like, Claudia, that opinion is absolute
shit, what are you talking about? Like I'm

355.text:
never gonna stop you doing that. But yeah,
I don't think attacking someone's opinion

361.text:
is attacking them personally and I think going
along with that line of thought, especially

364.text:
within families, I think that's quite dangerous
and I think it gets in the way of progression,

368.text:
and I don't like that at all. I think all
opinions should be able to be challenged.

372.text:
Yeah, I don't think you should be abusive
to a person and horrible to a person, and

378.text:
it's sad if that person feels like you're
attacking them rather than their opinion,

383.text:
but opinions can change and I do think that
you should have the right to attack anybody's

389.text:
opinion at any time to be honest, it's just
an opinion, it's not sacred.

393.text:
Anyway, that's the end of my vlog for today.
I am obsessed with In The Flesh at the moment,

398.text:
if you watched my last video you'll know.
I've watched it again, all the episodes, since

402.text:
I made that video. I'm so obsessed. I drew
Kieren two more times but I'm more proud of

407.text:
these efforts so before I go I'll just show
you those pictures.

411.text:
I put these posts on tumblr by the way so
you can reblog them if you like. Here's one

416.text:
of my drawings of Kieren I did. It's a coloured
pencil sketch and I kind of used like a cotton

422.text:
bud… in America do you call them Q tips?
I think you do. To kind of smudge the colours

426.text:
a bit, so that's lovely Kieren who is my favourite
character in In The Flesh and my joint favourite

432.text:
character of all time. And my one I did last
night, sorry I've just completely gone out

437.text:
of the frame then. Nice image of my wall and
my cushions. This is the one I did last night

441.text:
of Kieren... um, at a funeral, which I won't
say whose funeral or anything because last

448.text:
video I almost gave away massive spoilers
and I had to cut it out and I'm not doing

451.text:
that again. I'm such a fool. But anyway, I
really like this one. I kind of, um, there

455.text:
you go, look, have a look. Can you see it?
I can't see what I'm showing you now. Anyway,

459.text:
there he is. So yeah, that's coloured pencils
again and I just kind of smudged it so I'm

464.text:
happy with that. I used to go to art college
for a little while. I'm just gonna put this

468.text:
away again so you won't be able to see me
for a moment. I did used to go to art college

472.text:
for a little while but I had to drop out because
of my mental illness. I basically had a breakdown

476.text:
and started locking myself in bathrooms and
not being able to like walk around the campus

479.text:
and stuff and I eventually just had a total
breakdown and I had to drop out. Which was

483.text:
horrible but I did go to art college for a
while and I did art A Level and I got an A

487.text:
for my art A Level, so I love art. Art's very
important to me. Especially the Pre-Raphaelites.

490.text:
I love the Pre-Raphaelites.
Anyway, I'm gonna go now, this is already

493.text:
too long. So um I hope you enjoyed this strange
little vlog that was very vague and boring

497.text:
but um yeah. I'll see you soon with more videos
and stuff and my usual. Alright. I love you
